wards.name: Shibuya-ku
wards.description: Famous for its shopping districts and youth culture, Shibuya has specific trash collection schedules for its dense urban areas.

burnable.description: Kitchen waste, paper, wood, cloth, etc.

recyclable.description: Paper, cardboard, cans, bottles, PET bottles
recyclable.japanese: 紙、段ボール、缶、びん、ペットボトル

non_burnable.japanese: プラスチック、ガラス、金属、陶器

tips.title: Burnable Trash
tips.description: Make sure to drain all liquids and wrap food waste properly. Use designated bags.
tips.japanese: 液体を完全に切って、生ごみは適切に包んでください。指定袋を使用してください。

tips.title: Recyclable Items
tips.description: Rinse containers thoroughly and separate by material type. Flatten cardboard boxes.
tips.japanese: 容器をよく洗って、素材別に分けてください。段ボールは平らにしてください。

tips.title: Non-burnable Items
tips.description: Sharp objects should be wrapped in newspaper and labeled clearly.
tips.japanese: 危険な物は新聞紙で包んで、はっきりと表示してください。

wards.name: Shinjuku-ku
wards.description: Tokyo's major business and entertainment district with varied collection schedules across different areas.

burnable.description: Food waste, paper products, wood, textiles
burnable.japanese: 生ごみ、紙製品、木、布製品

recyclable.description: Paper, cardboard, metal cans, glass bottles
recyclable.japanese: 紙、段ボール、金属缶、ガラスびん

non_burnable.japanese: プラスチック、陶器、小型電化製品

tips.title: Business District Rules
tips.description: Commercial areas have different collection times. Check with your building management.
tips.japanese: 商業地域は収集時間が異なります。建物管理に確認してください。

tips.title: Recycling Centers
tips.description: Visit designated recycling centers for electronics and special items.
tips.japanese: 電化製品や特殊な物は指定のリサイクルセンターをご利用ください。

wards.name: Minato-ku
wards.description: Home to many embassies and international businesses, Minato has bilingual trash information available.

recyclable.description: Paper, cardboard, cans, bottles, PET bottles
recyclable.japanese: 紙、段ボール、缶、びん、ペットボトル

non_burnable.japanese: プラスチック、ガラス、金属、陶器

tips.title: International Residents
tips.description: English language support available. Contact ward office for assistance.
tips.japanese: 英語サポートがあります。区役所にお問い合わせください。

tips.title: High-rise Buildings
tips.description: Many buildings have centralized collection. Check with your concierge.
tips.japanese: 多くの建物は集中収集です。コンシェルジュに確認してください。

wards.name: Chiyoda-ku
wards.description: Tokyo's political and business center with strict waste management policies for government buildings.

non_burnable.japanese: プラスチック、ガラス、金属、陶器

tips.title: Government Buildings
tips.description: Special collection schedules apply to government and office buildings.
tips.japanese: 政府やオフィスビルには特別な収集スケジュールがあります。

tips.title: Security Considerations
tips.description: Some areas have restricted access. Contact ward office for details.
tips.japanese: 一部地域はアクセス制限があります。詳細は区役所にお問い合わせください。

wards.name: Meguro-ku
wards.description: Residential area known for its cherry blossoms and relaxed atmosphere with family-friendly collection schedules.

recyclable.description: Paper, cardboard, cans, bottles, PET bottles
recyclable.japanese: 紙、段ボール、缶、びん、ペットボトル

non_burnable.japanese: プラスチック、ガラス、金属、陶器

tips.title: Family-friendly Schedule
tips.description: Later collection times accommodate families with children.
tips.japanese: 遅い収集時間は子供がいる家族に配慮しています。

tips.title: Green Initiatives
tips.description: Strong focus on recycling and composting programs.
tips.japanese: リサイクルとコンポストプログラムに重点を置いています。

general_tips.title: Trash Bags
general_tips.description: Use designated trash bags for your ward. Regular plastic bags are not accepted.
general_tips.japanese: 指定のごみ袋を使用してください。普通のビニール袋は受け付けません。

general_tips.title: Collection Times
general_tips.description: Put trash out the night before collection day, not on the morning of collection.
general_tips.japanese: 収集日の前夜にごみを出してください。収集日の朝ではありません。

general_tips.title: Holiday Schedule
general_tips.description: Collection may be delayed on national holidays. Check ward website for updates.
general_tips.japanese: 祝日は収集が遅れる場合があります。区のウェブサイトで確認してください。

general_tips.title: Special Items
general_tips.description: For batteries, light bulbs, and electronics, use designated collection points.
general_tips.japanese: 電池、電球、電化製品は指定の収集場所をご利用ください。

metadata.notes: This data covers the 5 most populated wards. Additional wards can be added as needed.
